intro: Navarretia stricta, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its blooming period occurs in spring, producing clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Navarretia stricta is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
